Reviews.Title: “NOISY because of Jim Stafford Theater--probably won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: suezp
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days here--cozy reception area. Staff nice. Rooms comfortable, but nothing special or upscale--No microwave or refrigerator. Furniture needs to be updated. The floor in bathroom was a bit grungy with dirt in corners. The shower had mold/mildew. Breakfast had a wide select and was pretty good. Pastries tasted old. Coffee not that great. Booked this hotel online and didn't realize it was next door to the Jim Stafford Theater and it was very, very noisy. Because of this, we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lodge of the Ozarks in Branson”
Reviews.Author: kquinn5
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Lodge of the Ozarks in Branson. This hotel is rustic in decor with rough-hewn pine furniture that is quite unique. The hotel serves a free breakfast that includes eggs, a meat, and pancakes or french toast. The rooms are standard in size However, the halls are very long, so if you have difficulty walking, request a room closer to the lobby. Occasionally the elevator did not work, so ask for ground level if you have difficulty with stairs. The hotel is next door to Mikey Gilley's and several show venues are within walking distance. The staff is very pleasant (as is everyone I met in Branson) and they go out of their way to answer your requests.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute reservation-now I know why they had vacancies...”
Reviews.Author: mkbtla
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel kind of last minute because it turns out we were going to be coming to south Missouri a day early and couldn't get into the place we had already booked reservations with because they had no openings so we needed somewhere to stay for one night. I should have known that the pictures were way more deceiving at the price we got our two queen bed room ($89 +tax). We did get a standard room, but based on the pictures provided I guess I was just expecting a bit more especially because WE got a room with a "jetted whirlpool tub!" -- woo. First of all the TV is probably the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel room (not that EVERYONE looks at that) but the pics of ALL the rooms on the website that you see the TV have nice sized flat screens. Then in the bathroom the soaps were dirty, like they were left over and not even wiped off. Gross!! The drapes in our room were broken, so you couldn't close them all the way. The pool was closed for a portion of the night but did reopen. (And is WAY smaller in person) The restaurants food is NOT that great, but is cheap. (now we know why, esp since both my husband and I ended up in the bathroom later afterward, if you know what I mean) and to top it off, the ice machine didn't work on the 4th floor, so walked down to the 3rd only to discover there isn't one down there, so just skipped 2nd pretty much expecting there to at least be one on the 1st (because if there wasn't I was going to start to complain!). All in all I guess it could have been worse since this WAS a last minute reservation. Now I know why they had vacancies as opposed to the competition. It is in a decent area, but there are others (Radisson, Clarion...) that are in better areas, and those are more expensive (I think, otherwise I might cry) so in this case just know you get what you pay for. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Always”
Reviews.Author: LasVega5
Reviews.Content: We used to visit this lodge once or twice a year, never with a bad experience. It has now been several years due to my mom's health. She wanted to visit Branson one more time. Reading all of the reviews, I almost picked out another hotel because we needed a nice place with no issues. I'm not sure where most of these negative reviews are from, but I'm guessing they don't travel much. If they do, I'm guessing they have negative reviews about everything. Here is an honest review (because we don't have a dog in this race, nor any conspiracy theory about who really writes reviews). I used booking.com to reserve a room with 2 queens and a jetted tub, at a great price. When we arrived at 4:00, the front desk was very pleasant and helpful, and we were given the exact room we booked and the price we booked it for. It was in the main lodge on the 4th floor. The lodge was warm and welcoming, with a delightful decor. We took our bags up on the luggage cart, and I was prepared for issues (based on the prior reviews). Our room was fine. No, it did not look like the photo of the suite, but we did not pay for a suite. A large clean bathroom with a huge jetted tub, two queen sized beds with clean white linens on each. Moderate sized room with a window overlooking the courtyard. Everything worked fine. Yes, the TV was old and small. We did not go to Branson to watch TV, so this was fine. During our trip, we had daily housekeeping service. In fact, Lodge of the Ozarks hires some folks with special needs to assist with housekeeping duties. We love this!!! No, our room did not get vacuumed and mopped daily. Does your house? It was not necessary, we had the beds made and fresh towels and bathroom items. I guess we could have stayed at Lodge of the Four Seasons for 4x the price and had better service, but we were delighted with the level of service at this lodge. The pool was closed one day because a child threw up in it, and several families were making a big scene. My suggestion is to yell at the parents who let a sick child in the pool instead of the folks who were working hard to clean and sanitize the pool. It was opened again by 8:00pm and the kids had a blast. Be sure to stop in the gift shop with any questions on where to go and how to get there. The lady who works there knows all of the backroads and got me to the best outlet mall in 4 minutes avoiding 76 highway. I plan to come back and do all of my Christmas shopping at that mall (Coach Outlet, woo hoo), and will certainly stay here again. So convenient, clean and helpful. Oh, some folks even complained about the free breakfast buffet. Really? Feel free to go pay $10 at IHOP right down the street. We enjoyed the buffet daily, and there were different items each day. 4 choices of entrees. Did I mention it was free? The Club where it is served is beautiful and seats many people. Yep, it is true that they don't change the tablecloth after each group eats breakfast. Not sure why this is a deal breaker for some...but breakfast was really good. Did I mention free? Location was fantastic. We walked to White Water, Jim Stafford, go carts, mini golf, Mickey Gilley and ice cream. Easy trip out to get to Silver Dollar City. Best Branson Show ever was Eagles Tribute at God and Country Theatre. Great show for a fabulous price. We did not eat at the hotel (Mel's Hard Luck Diner is our favorite) but did have a couple of drinks at the bar. $2 large Bud Light and nice company. This hotel was great, I would rank it 4 stars (remember, you are in Branson, not Las Vegas) at a great bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: depositless
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and accommodating. Close to shows and nice restaurants. Didn't swim, but the pool looked great. I was there for the Power Advocacy Intensive Conference and was able to relax in between sessions. I would bring my family back.

Reviews.Title: “We brought a conference group...”
Reviews.Author: Lawyermom27
Reviews.Content: At the outset, you have to know that half the hotel has been remodeled. It is my understanding that the second half will be remodeled soon. As of this review, floors 1 and 2 were done. They were beautiful rooms! We brought a special needs parent group for a conference and had a wonderful time. The pool was very nice for families. The hotel was centrally located on the strip so that those without vehicles could easily walk to entertainment, food, etc. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Some of the carpets were older and stained, as noted in a few reviews, but those were cleaned prior to our arrival, and the conference room was beautiful. The hotel staff was very friendly and easy to work with. One of the gentlemen in maintenance saw me unloading tons of conference stuff in the rain and came out and helped me. Our families were treated very nice and we got great reviews of the hotel on our conference reviews. One thing people kept noting was that the hotel was more family oriented. With bigger conferences, sometimes the hotel is so pristine and cold that you don't feel comfortable with families. The rooms at this hotel were very nice (we got updated ones) but were not so formal that our families could not relax. They all voted to come back next year. I was very pleased with how well everything turned out.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LD1463
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel one king and one with two queen beds. The single king room was much nicer and seemed more updated than the queen room but both were clean. They do seem to have a challenge cleaning the lobby and other public areas. We found the staff to very friendly and accommodating. There were a few things that were on the tacky side such as requiring guests to go to the front desk for pool towels and displaying signs soliciting tips but I didn't find that sort of thing that unusual in a small town resort area. The complimentary breakfast was quite good with a higher quality of food than other hotels I have stayed in that offer breakfast to their guests. The hotel does seems to have a bit of an identity crisis when you consider all of the lodge theme decor and and the Las Vegas style lights on the outside of the building. Overall we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with lack of service”
Reviews.Author: Ken H
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a 4 day stay at this Motel. The Lobby is nice and spacious, but that is where it stopped. The pool water was cloudy and had some sort of white film on top of it. There seemed to be plenty of chlorine, based on the smell. Our room was on the 3rd floor, overlooking the indoor pool. The pool stays open till midnight, and every night there were a host of children playing and squeeling past the midnight cutoff time. There were also noises of other people walking up and down the hallways and slamming their doors until the wee hours of the morning. The maid staff had to be asked to service our room after the third day, (ignoring the "service please" sign) and the staff told us they usually don't service rooms that are staying over. She did service the room, make up the bed and bring fresh towels after being asked to do so. The room was comfortable and seemed to be clean enough. Our room was a king size bed and had an iron, hair dryer, microwave, coffee pot, and refrigerator. It also had a jacuzzi bath tub/shower. The interesting thing is there was an envelope asking for a tip for the maid staff when we arrived in the room. Check in time is 3pm, and they adhere to this pretty strictly. Find something else to do until 3pm if you arrive into town earlier. Check out time is 11am, which is early since you have been kept up by screaming kids in the pool till after midnight. The breakfast we ate at the attached diner was adequate and filling, but the one supper meal we ate there left a good deal to desired. The steak was greasy, thin, and tough and the pre-breaded shrimp were the frozen kind that you find at the grocery store. The motel is next door to Mickey Gilley's theatre and restaurant, which had good food and a pretty good show called "SIX."

Reviews.Title: “On the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DGregory1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property on business for 7 nights. The hotel is located on the strip with the Hughes Brothers Show on one side and Six's Show on the other. Both shows were great and just one minute walk from the hotel's front door. The noise from the show attendees in the parking lot is annoying when they let out. The hotel was very comfortable but under staffed. The room was furnished with a microwave, small fridge and bar sink. The room always felt dark regardless of how many lights you turned on or how far you opened the curtains. The room was a little dated and they tried to give it the 'Lodge' feeling. There was a whirlpool tub in the bath however I never use them when I travel. The food in the restaurant was very reasonable and good. For the price of a burger on the strip you can get a nice dinner at the hotel. I ate at the hotel 95% of the time even though there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The free breakfast buffet was excellent! All in all it was a nice stay and the staff was courteous and helpful even though the hotel was under staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourselves the trouble!”
Reviews.Author: Triparna d
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky person and most definitely not a vengeful one. The only reason I am writing this review is to save my fellow travelers the pain and frustration of a ruined vacation. I will try my best to be objective and state some of the concerns I have: We went to the Lodge of the Ozarks because we had purchased a Groupon. When we went there it seemed like we were treated like second grade citizens because we did not pay the full price, They did not honor the groupon cash they gave us (we lost about $50 worth as they did not ho nor the Groupons). Their toilets would leak creating moist floors in the bath. It was smelly. They did not change the towels or vacuum the floors. We had to ask twice in our five night stay for them to come back and redo (the janitors were very nice). The breakfast was also very low quality. The eggs were made of something with preservatives. They tasted very bad. Their restaurants did not have any set times. They closed at random hours. When we asked about the closing times, three different waiters gave us three different times. We were told the restaurant closes at 4 on Sunday, we went to eat at 2 and were told that they were closed.The groupon cash that we used was not honored by the hotel staff. All in all, it was such a frustrating experience. We vacation once a year and were really looking forward to some time off. But, the callousness and unprofessionallism of the hotel staff along with unclean rooms really ruined it for us. I hope that you will be saved of the trouble. I do not wish any one ill, but I truly hope they understand that we spend our hard earned money on our vacations and we deserve a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do they own a vacuum?”
Reviews.Author: traveler8658
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute trip on Expedia and as earlier comments have said, you are shunned for using travel websites to book a room here. We were put in one of the older rooms that has not been updated. Apparently there are some newer rooms and some older rooms. We asked about being moved to a newer room and were told to check back later. Checked back later and were then told to check back in the morning. Basically it seemed like we were being pushed off as a problem from one shift to the next because they didn't want to deal with the issue. I saw plenty of people checking out the next morning, yet none of the newer rooms were available. I feel like they could have accomodated us and let someone who checked in late take the older room, however we had booked through Expedia so I think they save the nicer rooms for people who book direct through the hotel website. The hallways have not seen a vacuum in weeks. In the photos, there is a toothpick and other debris on the floor that was there from Friday afternoon until Sunday morning. It wasn't an isolated problem either because we parked at a few different entrances and walked many sections of hallway. I could have attached dozens of photos of debris in the hallways. The elevator was even worse. For goodness sake people, run a vacuum down the hall! Have you ever heard of steam cleaning carpets? Also, the bannister on the stairs was covered in dust from top to bottom, even at the ground floor. I could understand the very top landing, but failing to clean down at the lobby is awful. The toiletries they provide and very low quality, low end products. Be aware, your room is not cleaned on a daily basis, only when you check out is it cleaned for the next guest (you hope). I saw the housekeeping manager in the hallway one morning staring into a dirty room trying to figure out how it did not get cleaned the day before. Breakfast buffet was nice except there is one lady to service 100's of guests for 3 hours. As a result, on our first morning they ran out of plates and knives. There was one pitcher of water and that didn't last very long with a few hundred people. They also ran out of clean tables due to a large group, but also because there was only one attendant servicing the whole thing. On day 2 they still did not have any knives plus they ran out of orange juice and pastries. When someone from the kitchen brought out more orange juice, they poured it from a large bucket into the serving unit. It was apparently from a concentrated mix because as he poured, a giant solid clump came out of the bottom. So it wasn't mixed correctly and tasted watered down for me. Whoever got the clumpy part got some surprise. We returned to the hotel late on Saturday night and had to park in back. All doors were locked and there is no card access system. I had to drive back to the front, go inside, and ask to have a door unlocked. Then drove back around to a parking space and came into the building. Had I not done this, I would have to walk from around the back of the building to the front door which might be as much as 1/4 mile. No big deal for me (although I was tired), however I could see some having a big problem with this. In our dated room, the shower handle have several pieces of plastic broken off of it. The furniture was beat up and the beds not very comfortable. I attached a picture of the ice machine, however you can't see it because it is blocked by a door so there was not way to get ice. There are fire doors at the end of the hallway and they are locked open and can only be released and closed by employees. Thus, when the door is open, which is most of the time, you can't reach the ice machine because it is strategically placed directly behing the open door. I attached a picture. This is clearly a hotel on the decline and not worth the cost of $100+ per night. Its more like a $60-70 room. Either they can't find people to work here which is possible, or they are pulling every penny out of the property in profits. They need far more housekeeping help, far more restaurant/buffet help, and a working vacuum. The employees we spoke with were nice, its just not a well run operation. I agree with earlier reviews which suspect employees of writing the favorable reviews. I saw nothing favorable here. I would replace the head of housekeeping immediately if I had any say in it. Its a shame because it could really be a nice place. I will definitely not return and will try someplace else next time. Words can't express the disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lacy M
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay and had a wonderful experience. We stayed on the second floor and our room was very nice and very clean. Breakfast was good, buffet style....eggs, hash browns, biscuits...the norm. The kids swam in the pool everyday and thought it was wonderful. The only complaint we had were that the beds were a little hard. We didn't hear any nose from other rooms. Our room was cleaned each evening when we returned. It's great location and connected to the Hughes Brothers theatre where we watched IT and it was really good. We have a 6 and a 4 year old and they both enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “3rd times a charm?”
Reviews.Author: BigBransonLover
Reviews.Content: I'll try to stick to just facts and keep it short but we really had a bad experience and I really want to give a honest review! We booked through priceline or travelocity...one of the booking websites, my husband took care of the reservations. We got a great price and we were really happy because the rooms looked great and we knew how much they normally were so the $79 a night we were paying made us feel like we were really lucking out! We got to the hotel Friday night around 8:30 PM. The check in alone took at least 15-20 min. They weren't that busy but it took awhile. We got up to our room and could not believe what we opened our door to! Curtains literally hanging off the rod on one side, pain peeling off the wall above the window, an airconditioner that looked like it was a decade old and wouldn't shut off and only one light because every other light was unplugged. The beds were old, really old and the room smelled so musty! I honestly couldn't believe it! I had my husband call down immediatly because I truly thought there had been a mistake! They asked him to come to the front desk so he did. He was told that the reason we rented an older room was because we had booked through a booking site! We told him that the site did not state there were "old" rooms. He told us that half the hotel has not been remodeled and that if you book through a site like travelocity you WILL be booked in the older part! We were going to leave...that is how bad the room was. He agreed to give us a newer room...after about 20 min. We moved rooms only to find the next one had it's own set of problems! Room 2...Walked in and it looked better. Not great and still out dated a bit even though it was supposed to be a newer room. Started to settle in and saw a horriable spot on the carpet beside the bed. It looked like someone had puked on it. The spot was all over the carpet and up the wall...still wet! Upon better inspection by my husband he noticed it looked like a water leak and he also saw black mold!!!! Sure enough the jacuzzi had been leaking through the wall. We called the front desk again and they said we couldn't stay in that room because of the mold...thank God!!! They said they couldn't find another room liked the one we had booked...double queen with jacuzzi tub. We told them we would take a normal double queen or anything they had because at this point we had been trying to get settled in for an hour!! Finally we got our 3rd room! This room was nicer but still very plain! For a room that is usually over $100 I would have expected alot more and had I paid that price I would have been really upset! This hotel is in major need of something...better management, better housekeeping, better maintence, better breakfast! They need a complete overhaul! I would not recommend this hotel at all! After all that trouble the staff were nice but they were not overly sorry. Really I would have thought if someone had that much trouble they would have said sorry and at least acted like they cared. There are plenty of hotels in Branson...avoid this one! One last thing...the walls here are super thin! If your a light sleeper you won't get a wink of sleep! You can hear when the people in the next room wake up...the water, the rustling around and even thier conversations!

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean and extremely outdated.”
Reviews.Author: cntrydancetwinmom
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here because our flight was changed and we missed it so had to stay one extra day until we could get our next flight. This place looks appealing on the outside and the lobby is nice, but you don't want to go farther than that. Extremely outdated, not very clean, hard beds, the walls in the bathroom had dirty spots on them that I was able to clean off myself and the "whirlpool tub" that is in the room had a moldy, musty smell to it and I was afraid to let my kids use it because it smelled so bad. It is also the bathtub and shower so once you stand in this "whirlpool tub" to take a shower you literally have to bend over to get your head wet and wash your hair...and I'm only 5'1"!!!!!! The tv is archaic, the restaurant is where the lounge is and the location that is supposed to be the restaurant has been under "renovation" for two years now. It basically looks like they closed it down and just use it as storage. Breakfast was very mediocre and was buffet style served in their ballroom which was dank, and dusty. It was hard to find a table with a tablecloth that didn't have a nasty stain on it. One other note, I know this isn't the hotel's fault, but we were looking for a hotel with a pool since we had to stay one extra day and needed something fun for our kids to do since we didn't have our rental car anymore. Some kid pooped in the pool and they had to close it down for 24 hours for maintenance. Bad timing for us I guess. Will not ever go back and do not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice room....but”
Reviews.Author: Pickles313
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel..if u stay make sure u ask for a room that has been remodeled or updated. They are more in price tho... my room was clean but i had alot if trouble sleeping in their beds. I felt like u was sleeping on the floor! Very hard beds! Im uses to a pillow top tho... very good location if u have kids. I would stay again... if i knew it wouldnt kill my back :(

Reviews.Title: “Not too pleased”
Reviews.Author: vgdg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spacious with king bed and jacuzzi.On our second day the room was not vacuum or dusted same with the bathroom. The third was the same. Jacuzzi and the floor not cleaned. The only thing they do is to change your towel & fixed your bed. The coffee pot not cleaned after we used it and no replacement bag of coffee to brew. With this size of the room we expect to have 2nd mirror in the room.(Only the bathroom has). Their Wi-Fi is free but you cannot access it in the bedroom. You have to go the lobby to be connected. Staff in their restaurant are very courteous except that they have limited people to assist you. The food is okay except that some of the menu selection are not available when you ask for it. The waiter should mention immediately to the customer what is not available, in that way the customer will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Nurseokie
Reviews.Content: The bad-beds were hard, only one mirror, Water pressure low, could hear neighbors in rooms next door and above, and pool not clean and hot tub not working right. The good- nice lobby, loved the checkers In the front lobby good hot free breakfast Good location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lodge”
Reviews.Author: KasD69
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific experience. Everyone was friendly and helpful. All of the facilities were well maintained. The location is perfect right on the main drag by many attractions and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe 4 stars in the '70's.”
Reviews.Author: Mostlyhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from a groupon deal. It wasn't a deal! Maybe 4 stars in the '70's. The toilet didn't work. It was old and discussing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Reneer06
Reviews.Content: The room was really nice and big and very clean and the staff was very courteous

Reviews.Title: “Summer 2012”
Reviews.Author: impulse72
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jun 7 2012 -Jun 11 2012. This property has great hospitality, the including breakfast was wonderful. It is one of the best locations if you need flat terrain outside on the hotel grounds - it sits at one of the most level spot on Hwy 76 - no inclines to walk up or down. Directly next to Mickey Gilleys theater. The concerns we had were with the room - for the price it is missing some of the appreciated amenties. Only one mirror and sink which is in the bathroom. No other mirrors to get ready by in the hotel room. With 3 people staying it was a slow process in the morning waiting to use the bathroom mirror. Would be a great option to have a full length mirror added to the room or even a small extra one. The cable tv had very limited channels - the branson channel of show info didnt work. The beds were fine and the water pressure was weak in the shower. Not deal breakers but, for the nightly cost it doesnt meet some of the other hotels in its catagory. They do seem to still be adding so we would try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: Becky W
Reviews.Content: VERY disappointed! We travel to the Branson area often and typically stay in a condo but have thought several times about staying at Lodge of the Ozarks. What a huge mistake! At first the only thing going for them was the friendly staff which I have since changed my opinion. The room did not look like any of the pictures that we saw on line. The air conditioning was turned off in the room and the curtains were open with the sun beaming into the room. Why would you do that in June on a very hot day! It took a long time for the room to finally cool down. The beds are extra hard, do not move at all when you sit down. Shower head in bathroom is very low, we had to bend down to wash hair. There was a chair at what I guess is like a vanity, the chair looked like it was from a restaurant, a very old restaurant. No towels at the pool. No safety latch on the doors, so anyone could walk in or a child could open the door and walk out. We ordered food from the restaurant and it took them over an hour and a half (no room service). They said they only had 2 people working. Who does that on a Saturday night in June in Branson that does not make sense to me! The person that checked us in was very pleasant. Although she said she needed our car tag number sometime before we left. When I checked out they were confused as to why she had needed it and did not take it. I told the lady at check out we were not happy, she said sorry here is a comment card. I filled out the card and gave it to her. Now our card has been charged 30 dollars too much! They said, oh it is an incidental fee it should come off. They never told us anything about an incidental fee and the bank said it came through as a charge not a hold or authorization. I ask that they get the card I filled out and add some tongs to it. The girl on the phone came back after 10 minutes and said that the person who had them was in a meeting. I have ask that he calls me back with the card. We will see! Would not stay again! Oh and breakfast, it was included but not the food was not good. All the tables were dirty and we ask About a clean table. The waitress said oh we do not change the linens until after breakfast. I was not wanting that changed, but they could wipe off the food and crumbs from the previous person!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Beautiful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny G
Reviews.Content: I went to the Lodge of the Ozarks for my first trip to Branson MO, stayed 4 days and 3 nights. I was very impressed by the overall look of the Lodge. The lobby was very open and roomy with beautiful furnishings and comfortable sitting areas. There was a ton of neat and original things to buy from their gift shop. All of the staff their treated me great like I was more then just a customer, they wanted to ensure I was having a good time...very friendly and welcoming! There was so much to do just with in the hotel, from the indoor swimming pool and Jacuzzi, to the Rafters restaurant and the elegant Bar with a running waterfall. At night it was nice to relax out on the patio with the big fountain, I could see all the lights from the local theaters nearby (kinda made me feel as if I was in Vegas :) I stayed on the 2nd floor and absolutely loved everything about my room. The furniture was really nice, new and comfortable. I had a small fridge and kitchen sink, flat screen TV, comfy bed and cannot forget to mention big Jetted bathtub! In the mornings I was treated to a big free breakfast buffet in the restaurant, everything was fresh and hot and yummy. This is a place I will be returning to and recommending to my friends and family when they are looking for a retreat. The only bad thing was that I couldn't have stayed longer. KUDOS to everyone at the Lodge it was more than what I expected!!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Debbie1152
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Lodge of the Ozarks! The lobby is enormous and majestic. I stayed in a room on the 2nd floor; the bed was amazing and very comfortable. I even had a cute little swan created out of a towel from the maid. I love sleeping in a cool room, so I set the thermostat (as I always do when I first get in a room) to 68. I stayed for two nights and my room was crispy cool :) My room had a nice quality flat screen TV and a little kitchen area. The bathroom had a HUGE jetted tub… that was the frosting on the cake for me. I saw the SIX show on my first night, it was amazing. Those guys can sing! The best part? Walking right next door to the hotel after the show! I walked to the Go Cart track the last day of my stay and enjoyed some frozen custard after. There is so much to do in Branson, and with the hotel being right in the middle of the theater district… so much is within walking distance! The pool is amazing! It is heated and indoor. There are balconies from four floors of rooms overlooking the pool. Two walls have sliding glass doors/walls so you can open them up and have a really nice indoor/outdoor environment. The hot tub was perfectly hot. I cannot wait to come back in the winter to swim! The staff was amazing! They answered all my questions and made wonderful suggestions. My room was cleaned promptly and the food is amazing… try the Branson Burger! I will definitely stay here again. This time I’ll bring my kids, they will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnUnck
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 3 nights at the Lodge of the Ozarks. The rooms were very nice and the staff was friendly. I would recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Introduction to Branson Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: My son and I flew from Utah to meet with family in Branson. We stayed at the Lodge of the Ozarks and it was a wonderful place for families to get together. I loved the homey feel right from the start. I love to read and the lodge has many beautiful comfy spots to sit and read, meet people, play games, or reconnect with family. I love the way the lodge is decorated and waking up one morning to find Valentines decorations that had been put up during the night. Our room was awesome! I am a picky sleeper but the beds, pillows and comforter provided for an excellent nights rest. We had a room overlooking the large pool which had cute flowers on every table and the kids wanted to live in it. I didn't mind because unlike most hotels I stay in the water was warm. My kids usually end up freezing and doing the lip quiver but not here. We had quite a few kids in our group and the staff was very patient and helpful. They even gave them a special treat that the kids appreciated. The manager Robin was genuinely kind and helpful. I can tell that she is passionate about hospitality and worked endlessly to make our stay feel like a true vacation from the regular worries of life. I had a light bulb go out during my 4 day stay and maintenance was there to replace it within 5 minutes of my call. Another maintenance man stopped to talk to my son who had asked him a question and squatted down to his level for the conversation. I loved that he thought to do that. I hadn't planned on returning to Branson but after my stay here I definitely want to. I hear it's especially wonderful during the Christmas Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Lodge is clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: angels622
Reviews.Content: On our recent visit to Branson I found a good price for rooms at the Lodge of the Ozarks. Since I had my son and his family along we wanted adjoining rooms with a crib and frig. They accommodated us with all of the above. The free breakfast buffet was a nice hot breakfast in a very pleasant room. The ladies serving breakfast were especially friendly. I would consider staying here again if our usual favorite places to stay in Branson were booked.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Laura D
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Branson for business, but as I was greeted in the lobby by the warm Lodge of the Ozarks' staff, I immediately felt like I was "home"! Always cheerful and helpful, the entire staff made every effort to ensure that my stay was enjoyable. My room was very spacious, I savored each meal that I had in the restaurant, and I loved all of the gorgeous Christmas decorations that brightened each corner! The manager of the hotel, Robin, was never without a smile and she truly made me feel like a VIP! Clearly her positive attitude has set the tone for the rest of her wonderful staff. When I return to Branson in the future, the Lodge of the Ozarks will always be my hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at this beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dolores M
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my friend on Nov. 9th...and checked out on Sunday, the 13th. We were greeted immediately by the office staff with a friendly smile and given our room keys where we found queen size beds in a comfortable and cozy room. We were given breakfast tickets where I thought we were having continental breakfasts each day. To my surprise we were thrilled to see a full size buffet with scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, french toast, cereal, fresh fruit, sweet rolls, oh, and biscuits and gravy. Of course, orange juice, coffee, both decaf and regular to top off this fantastic breakfast we had each of our mornings there. For the first time, I slept well because it was so quiet. No footsteps overhead, no sounds from the adjoining rooms, nothing....quiet...we were so surprised that we never heard the service staff cleaning the rooms....the other thing that I loved so much is the fantastic decorating in this hotel! One could feel the warmth of a beautiful fire in a fireplace with Christmas decorations lavishly and carefully done in the lobby and everywhere you looked. When I needed my boarding passes printed out, they were done by the staff as well. I cannot say enough about my stay as I already figured out that Branson people are all around friendly anyway. Robin, the manager, is a hard worker who shows herself throughout the day. You would come back in the evening late and there she was....always with a smile. Hopefully I can return next year with my husband because I already feel I have a family there that will welcome us. The hotel is very close to the main attractions. Who could ask for anything more?

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Miseryinbranson
Reviews.Content: The management of this dive does not respond well to customer's situation. Being in a room with a faulty thermostat where the temperature makes the situation almost unbearable. Cannot even open the door for relief because it overlooks the pool which has a strong stench of chlorine. At all costs avoid at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Karis S
Reviews.Content: We were there for a retreat with a large number in our group. Taken care of very well. Great food, clean rooms and friendly staff. One in our group fell and Ronin was right there to help take her to the ER. That was beyond what she would need to do in her position. Will go back ther the next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Hurry if you want to see what bed bugs look like.”
Reviews.Author: Larry D
Reviews.Content: This place was disgusting. We pulled back our sheets and saw bed bugs. The staff was sloppy and rude. The management was insincere and patronizing. We got out of that filthy place so fast. We stayed here last year and had the best trip. Don't know what has happened but we will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized and sloppily run!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tribojet
Reviews.Content: Upon first look we were very pleased with this Lodge. Unfortunately from there it went downhill. They had a computer glitch and it took one and a half hours to get checked in, The breakfast line was long all morning and they were constantly running out of food. The bartenders were in experienced and rude. They were out of coffee so no coffee drinks. No ice cream so no ice cream drinks. The rooms were fine they weren't what we asked for (adjoining) and did I mention we had reservations that were done six weeks before? Won't darken the doors of this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but the worst service I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: Beginning with the ck in process, this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Upon arriving at the 3pm ckin time, our party of 3 with 2 rooms, found that our reservation had been cancelled. The front desk was manned with 1 young woman, who could not find our reservation by name. Several min later, once we provided her with our confirmation numbers, she was able to pull it up by those numbers, and found that our reservation had been cancelled at 3:40AM that very morning. We had made the reservation six weeks prior, and had confirmed again 2 days prior. Once she realized that we were not taking "no reservation!" for an answer and that we intended to get our rooms, she proceeded to request a manager to help us. All the managers were in a mtg, 1 person at the front, and she had 2 large groups cking into the hotel, too. After waiting at least half an hour for a mgr to appear, and explaining our story no less than 3x, we received attention from a couple of mgrs. We were asked to go have lunch in the hotel restaurant, and was shown to the "manager's table" for lunch (that was funny since it was just a table in the corner in an almost empty restaurant in the middle of the afternoon). One hour and 45 min after arriving, we were able to ck in. The mgr brought us our room numbers while we were dining (at OUR expense), and assured us all was taken care of. As we returned to the front desk, again, another young woman could not locate the reservation, and had to call a mgr for clarification and to release those rooms to us. As requested in the original reservation, and again, upon cking in the first time, our rooms were supposed to be adjoining. They were not. We remained in them and didn't say anything, as it was not worth it. The entire stay was riddled with bad service, including bartenders who could not mix simple drinks without a recipe, not being able to make any coffee drinks or ice cream drinks on the bar menu (practically half the menu), because the restaurant was closed late at night. The third morning we even gave up trying to eat the free breakfast at the hotel, because the VERY large groups staying there as well, were dominating the breakfast room for over 2 hrs. Long lines, constantly running out of coffee, difficulty getting around people and getting a table, and the staff coming through twice with large tables to set up a room, made it impossible for anyone BUT those groups to enjoy breakfast. WHY in the world didn't they put those folks somewhere else for breakfast, so regular non-group guests could manuever thru the area??? While the rooms were clean and comfortable, one of our rooms had a toilet leak we advised them of twice, and the other room had a non-brand TV and remote, that required standing in front of the tv to use (you could NOT use it from the bed). I am sure that we paid at least $20 per night more than the groups that stayed there and received TERRIBLE service because this hotel does not have the intelligence working for them to know what good customer service is and is clearly not equipped to handle large groups. We were VERY unhappy with our stay! On a good note, the sales mgr, a pleasant, smiling, energetic young woman, spoke to us and served us at the Dixie Stampede, and was so nice and offered SUPERB service there...too bad she works for a hotel that she needs to bring up to the same level of service. The gentleman manager that helped us at the hotel, could have offered to pay for our lunch, after our long wait at checkin. That would have gone a long way to make us feel better after the long drive there and difficulty checking in. We would never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for some but not all”
Reviews.Author: BornTooLoose
Reviews.Content: This place seems to cater to veterans' reunions. If you like seeing groups of elderly vets, this is the place for you. If not, maybe not. Rooms and service are excellent; business center limited to one computer in a corner of the lobby, often with a line of people waiting. Breakfast is undistinguished, with only scrambled eggs and a few other options: bacon or ham or sausage; pancake or waffle; narrow choice of cereals etc. Other meals no better than so-so, and sometimes there's one overworked server for eight or nine tables. One notable feature is Andy's Frozen Custard, two doors down: the best we've ever had, with a brilliant variety, all fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: nhlupine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lodge of the Ozarks for a Viet Nam 101st Airborne Reunion, and the staff could not have made us feel more welcome. Although there was some construction going on in the dining room, they managed to feed us all daily and have a lovely banquet for us on our closing night. The hospitality room provided was in a perfect location. The room was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lodge of the Ozarks”
Reviews.Author: JoAnna F
Reviews.Content: This hotel rates high on so many levels. The rooms are large, clean and beautifully decorated. The staff could not have been more anxious to assist with anything. All areas of the hotel were clean and the banquet rooms were just perfect. The patio area next to the pool was the perfect place to sit around in the evenings and relax. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best so Far”
Reviews.Author: oliver b
Reviews.Content: I have made several trips to Branson in the past decade and stayed in different lodging each time. The Lodge of the Ozarks was by far the most pleasant. A very polite and helpful staff,clean rooms and central location will make it my first choice on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “someone left a loofah”
Reviews.Author: coloradorbust
Reviews.Content: The people are super nice here. However, during our stay i noticed a loofah had been left hanging on shower curtain. I called front desk and report this stated housekeeping must have not seen it. The loofah was never removed. i guess i should have asked for it to be removed. Didnt think i should have to ask but all in all it is a fair place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: famof5iowa
Reviews.Content: My family spent two nights at the Lodge of the Ozarks and this is a hotel I would not hesitate to stay at again and again. Rose in the gift shop was great at helping us purchase show tickets and Rachel at the front desk was very kind and helpful as well. Overall the general ammenities and rooms are similar to hotels you might be able to find a little cheaper up the street (say a hampton or holiday inn) however the cleanliness of the hotel and our room, the friendly staff and the location make this a hotel I will most likely return to in the future!!!!! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: irishgram69
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and well supplied. The staff, from the front desk, the supervisors, the cleaning staff, kitchen staff, were all very pleasant, friendly, and caring. Never heard any of them complaining or making remarks about each other or guests. The location was great and well within walking distance of restaurants, and shows. We had a very enjoyable time. We were there as part of a large group and they were most accommodating to our group. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Level of Service - Exceeding Expectations”
Reviews.Author: JZRIV
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with a large group that selected Lodge of the Ozarks as the host hotel for its international classic car show. My wife and I assisted with functions during the show and we did not hear one complaint about the hotel which is rare because some people just like to complain. The rooms were nicer than expected, The hot breakfast provided every morning was excellent with attentive wait staff. Robin the manager is a wonderful person and her values and work ethic were reflected by the whole staff. Kimberly was exactly the same way and always seemed to magically appear when we needed something. We have been doing national events across the country in differnet locations for over 20 years and this was the best service we ever received by a host hotel. Not enough space here to describe everything they did for us and all for very reasonable rates. It was so refreshing to find a service oriented bsuiness in todays world that meets this high standard. If competing hotels wanted to train their staff on how to run a hotel, they should just send them to Lodge of the Ozarks for a weeks stay. We will be hard pressed to find another hotel that meets the the standard set by Robin and her team. God Bless you for making our stay an awesome axperience.

Reviews.Title: “The Brochure is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: MrsFoxyRoxy
Reviews.Content: After looking at all the photos, we decided to stay here for the family reunion. Looks are deceiving. It is really just a glorified low budget motel 6 type place. They spent so much money on the lobby and exterior, there was nothing left by the time they got to the rooms. The complementary breakfast is the same every morning and a big joke--the eggs come in a bag they heat up need I say more?!! The beds are pretty hard and I would vote the front desk staff as highly incompetent and indifferent. The rooms were shabby but clean, that is the best thing I can say about the lodge. You have a choice, I'd choose somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: sksloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lodge three days. The rooms need updating and each morning we had to deal with ants on the vanity and floor of the bath. The pool is nice and well maintained, but not heated. On our second day we came back to the hotel early evening and the parking lot was roped off and parking was allowed only for members of a car club that had arrived at the hotel. We were instructed to park our vehicle in the lot at the rear of the hotel. On our last evening we arrived back at our room ready to relax and retire early only to find a group from the car club sittting in lawn chairs and visiting outside of our hotel window. The restaurant was closed for repairs. It seemed "closed". A limited menu was available at the hotel grill. As others have commented , the breakfast buffet was repetitive and no cups were supplied to bring coffee back to the room. The staff was very friendly. When checking out I told the front desk clerk about our problems. She was mildly sympathetic. We live close to the Branson area and visit quite often. With the huge array of accomodations available, we will stick to our favorites from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff of any Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2806Ohio
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel that had such friendly staff from Rachel at the front desk, to the girl that was the breakfast attendant, to the lady in the gift shop. The hotel was very nicely kept, the pool was a nice size for a hotel (3' - 4' deep). My family did not feel the beds were comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was very good for a couple days but after that we got tired of it. It never changed and we were there for five nights. It consisted of biscuits/gravy, scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, bite size muffins, 2 kinds of cereal and juice/coffee. We always look for a hotel with a complimentary breakfast to save us money from having to eat out that meal, but by the end of the week we were having to find somewhere for a change. If you choose to eat breakfast out, I would suggest the Downtown Diner in old Branson. Wow, what good food and nice size portions (delicious homemade cinnamon rolls also)!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to ever stay at when visiting Branson, Missouri!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Babe1968
Reviews.Content: The Lodge of the Ozarks is the best place we have ever found to stay at when we are visiting Branson or passing through to somewhere else. You won't find a cleaner or nicer place. All of the rooms are spacious and smoke-free. The Lodge is on the "The Strip" which makes many attractions within walking distance. Best excellent rooms the Lodge also has a restaurant, gift shop, indoor heated swimming pool, live entertainment, and a nightclub to take your special someone for dancing. We have been coming to the Lodge ever since they opened and you won't find a friendlier group of people who do their best to make sure that your visit there is everything it should be and more. You won't find a better place in Branson that 's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha18
Reviews.Content: The only place I want to stay at when I'm in Branson, MO. The hotel has great service and friendly staff. The rooms are very clean, neat, and very spacious. Hope to be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely GREAT hotel...with one caveat!”
Reviews.Author: bushlamo
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel for an anniversary celebration and found it to be absolutely great, from start to finish. The check-in staff was super, the room was wonderful--a jacuzzi room on the second floor, and the rates were very reasonable. The hotel is very inviting, very comfortable and very clean. Had a bar on site, and a restaurant that served a very good hot breakfas buffet as one of the "perks." The only problem we had with this hotel was the beds--a tad harder than what we are comfortable with. Other than that, it is a great place to stay, and will probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lodge of the ozarks-WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Coull
Reviews.Content: We attended a Navy reunion. The staff was most accomodating, friendly and very helpful. Especially the young lady at the front desk on Saturday and Sunday mornings. The rooms were very clean, and kept that way. The restaurant staff was as good as the front desk people. I highly recommend this Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “The Lodge is cozy and the staff is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: wcbeckie
Reviews.Content: I met some friends that were in town on business. We met at the Lodge. I was really impressed with the new renovations. It is really warm and inviting. The staff was so helpful and actually really pleseant. The location is perfect and I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family who might be visiting Branson in the very new future. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is absolutely fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: jeanie63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lodge of the Ozarks for 10 days for a military reunion. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were very clean. But, the best thing of all was the staff, they went out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant and they did a great job. It would be nice if they had a laundry facility on site, maybe on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “WWII Reunion Held Here”
Reviews.Author: Gatorjw9088
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best reunion that our group has ever had. The service was excellent. The Lodge worked with us at the last minute on a breakfast in their CLUB for a presentation and it went off without a hitch. This is the most family friendly place that I have ever stayed and I would highly recommend it to any Reunion planner. I am/was the planner for our WWII Reunion. The on site restaurant was absolutely FANTASTIC. Robin the manger worked so hard to make everything work out for us. What a great new Chef they have as well. Just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place - everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: MrsG1989
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful. The room spacious and clean. The people were friendly and the service was great! We will definitely mark this as our place to stay next time in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Family058
Reviews.Content: When we got there every thing was ine intil that night (are room had a balcony) we went on the balcony which was right over the pool so the people below us thow a penny up and when they throw it up the pool cleaner was right blow where the penny fell and landed right in front of him and he people who thow the penny up ran inside and the guy looked up and saw us instaid of the people and then at 12:00am a guy came and banged on our door but we didnt anser until the people called our room and said that we would be fined 50$ for thowing a penny at the person and we tolad them that we did not throw it and they said that we wouldnt be fined 50$ sothe next they when we checked out when we checked out they said that we wold be fined 50$ even no the person on the phone said that we wouldnt be fined the money and we kept on telling the people that we didnt thow the penny and we told then that the the people below us thorw the penny so they won and we hab to pay the money but the people were very RUDE!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KansasNoah
Reviews.Content: I attended a church woman's convention at the Lodge of the Ozarks recently and I must say that it was one of the best conventions that we have ever had! The facilities were great, the people there were great and the experience was great! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to know where they should stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel that I have stayed at in the last five years.”
Reviews.Author: WayneSuckowSr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and shipshape. I had discussions with the people there from managers, receptionists, chefs, wait people, maintenance people, and others. All personal were very kind, polite and concerned that our stay was as enjoyable as possible. I will be booking a reunion there for next year. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: rosber
Reviews.Content: Close to a lot of theatres, close to Factory outlets close to Titanic museum The Jeerk Show at the Hughes Theatre must be seen

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Branson”
Reviews.Author: ashrn2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations by far. First of all, The hotel was beautiful inside and out. There was about three different areas to go outside and relax that were very inviting whether it be by the waterfall or out back in the Gazebo. The inside was also very inviting. The room was very nice. It was obvious that the staff took extra time just too make your room inviting with things like towels rolled up to make a swan on the bed, etc. There was also a restaurant that had a complimentary breakfast or you could pay for a hot breakfast. This hotel was very convienient to all attractions.There were many other things about this hotel we enjoyed. I wont even have to search for a branson hotel anymore because I have found one.

Reviews.Title: “veterans reunion”
Reviews.Author: grandma05
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lodge of the Ozarks was wonderful. The rooms were very nice and the staff was great. The pool area is nice, though the hot tub is small. They even have free lollipops. The food in the restaurant was good. The hotel is a bit more expensive than others, but the amenities are much better. It was great for reunions.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: fredmona
Reviews.Content: Held Navy Reunion here. Enjoyed by all. Will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel In Branson,MO”
Reviews.Author: preacherswife61258
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Lodge of the Ozarks for a reunion. The staf was great; anything we asked for they went out of their way to provide. The front desk help was avaibale 24/7 to do anything they could to make our stay more comfortable. Rooms were very clean & comfortable (I especially enjoyed the jacuzzi tub after a long day). We were within walking distance of many entertainment facilities. The food & wait staff in the restaurant where top notch. Portions were great & the food was delicious. I would HIGHLY recommend thid Lodge to anyone going to Branson!!

Reviews.Title: “Lodge of the Ozarks the ONLY Place to Stay When Visiting Branson, Mo.”
Reviews.Author: Babe1968
Reviews.Content: The Lodge of the Ozarks is a vacationer's dream. It has all the amenities any hotel can offer in addition to being reasonably priced. If you are in the mood to dance, swim, workout, or even take in a live show ....you can do any or all of these without having to leave the comfort of your lodging. They have great food and extraordinary entertainment like the group SIX who have been seen on television. They have a wonderful staff of friendly people who's goal is to make this your best vacation ever in Branson. They are right on 76 Boulevard within walking distance on many shows, shops and other forms of entertainment. Whether you are on vacation or on a business trip the Lodge of the Ozarks in Branson, Missouri is the place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: blue_tater
Reviews.Content: Was a bit disappointed that I did not get the newly remodeled room that I reserved over the Internet, but room was still great and very large. TV was a bit small for the size of room. Bathroom was nice and had a jacuzzi tub that my kids loved. The pool area was very nice and the pool was large but not deep anywhere. Overall though, the kids liked the pool. Hot tub was nice. The free breakfast was not much breakfast and the first day we were there, so many people were around that they couldn't keep up. Breakfast bars, boxes of cereal and danish were the only food items available. They also had milk, juice and coffee. We ended up going out for breakfast both days.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful anniversary night”
Reviews.Author: brittraveller10
Reviews.Content: the lodge of the ozarks was such a great place for my husband and i to spend our anniversary night. the staff was very helpful with things we needed, and we enjoyed the quiet pool and hot tub. rooms appear to be recently updated with nice bedding, great beds, and lcd tvs. we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda152
Reviews.Content: great food, breakfast buffet, very quiet for sleeping

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vijeli
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with a group for a Navy reunion. The hotel was very nice. The cleaning staff was very friendly. The pool was nice. The temperature was really warm but it was only 4 feet deep in the center. The only issue we had was that they lost our mail. My mother had left some of her medicine at home. She called my sister who mailed it the next day. We notified the desk we were expecting a package. Well, two days later we checked at the desk for our package. The desk staff had logged into a notebook that it was received and put it in a file drawer. We never received it. The next day it still was not found. The women who logged it in stated she had followed policy and even left a message on our phone (we never received any messages) and had no idea what happened to it. Never did she say she was sorry (though others did). My mother had to call her doctor and have a prescription called into a local pharmacy. Thank goodness we drove or they would had to fetch it (they should have anyway). Otherwise we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately come back again”
Reviews.Author: alviva
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was recently remodeled and the results were very impressive. Everything was rustic with a cozy comfortable feel. It made me feel right at home but without distracting from the sense of where we were. It was a great fir for the natural setting of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Lodge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeDatSLC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in recently remodeled rooms on the second floor and loved the upgrade. The location is great and the staff is very friendly and they keep if very clean. The food was ok, and the pool is a little old but the beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed the stay. We felt it is the nicest hotel in Branson for the money compared to the others we looked into staying at.

Reviews.Title: “The whole family loved Lodge of the Ozarks.”
Reviews.Author: sprite11
Reviews.Content: Everyone was friendly. The rooms were clean. The beds , linens, and pillows were very comfortable. In fact, my teenage son wanted to know if I could buy him one of the pillows. The breakfast buffet had a lot of variety and i was surprised to find plenty left when we arrived at 9:30. Both of the kids said they want to stay there the next time we go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have wanted in a conference center....and more!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jvillager
Reviews.Content: The Lodge of the Ozarks was our choice for a church conference for 170 women. The staff bent over backwards to serve us and made our experience perfect in every way. The lobby is elegant, the rooms are spotless and comfortable and the food was very tasty and well presented. The Crystal Hall was perfect for our meetings and dinners. Each staff member we dealt with was kind and helpful. I would choose this fine facility again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: rbsdd
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the hotel, the room we were given over the phone( confirming our online reservation) was to be poolside with a balcony, but was closed for "deep cleaning", so we were given an interior room. The hallway to the room was almost as hot as was the temperature outdoors. The air conditioner in the room had not been turned on, we were told, to "save money on the electric bill ". The room had a bad musty odor, and one of the numbers was missing from the door. We went to the pool only to discover the hot tub was as cold as tap water, and the staff were informed 4 seperate times to no avail. The swimming pool heater was working though and was the temperature of very warm bath water. Not what you want in the heat of summer, especially after being out all day touring the sites in 100 plus degree temperature. Would never dream of staying with them in the future. Paid way too much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , convenient location”
Reviews.Author: OzarkMtnLady
Reviews.Content: Walked to the Jim Stafford show and restaurants. The room was very clean, well-appointed if not especially large. Breakfast was good. There's a comedy club in the hotel that's unlike anything else in Branson. If you want to be in the middle of the Branson "strip" at a nice, clean place, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Navy Reunion At The Lodge”
Reviews.Author: RoseSTORES
Reviews.Content: Our stay was GREAT. We attended the USS MONTROSE REUNION OCT18TH-21ST. The room was clean, the breakfast was just fine. The employes were all friendly. We enjoyed everything the Lodge has. It was a great place for the 2007 gathering of our Rose family. Sincerely, Bob Mc Roberts, 1965- 1967 on the APA212. THANK YOU ALL, Mac

Reviews.Title: “Average but some advantages”
Reviews.Author: Rt66tbird
Reviews.Content: I would tend to agree with most of the reviews both pro and con. My room showed some wear but was fairly large and comfortable. One young man working the desk was very helpful. The others were so, so. My message light was on but no instructions as to how to retrieve the message. Desk people did not know how accomplish what should have been simple for them. Good location. Close to several shows and activities. Just a short distance to a stop light intersection that can route you to either of the two main by-pass routes. The $4 breakfast is all right for a quick solution but there are a number of more extensive breakfast buffets for the same money in the area. The in-house, Club Vegas, offers good dining.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: smoky1
Reviews.Content: not super friendly at check in or out--room was clean, a/c was very cold , breakfast was confusing. cold breakfast was free but the hot food you had to pay FOUR DOLLARS . location is good especially is you have micky gilley tickets-it is right next door--

Reviews.Title: “bad expierance..won't go back!”
Reviews.Author: SAM1107
Reviews.Content: When i looked online to book a date, the lodge said it was all booked..i really wanted to stay there so we went ahead and went there once we got to branson, the first guy we dealt with when we made a reservation was friendly and when i told him about online he said that hadn't been updated in months, ok thats fine. We wanted a king suit, the only had a queen and we were fine with that , however... when we got to our room, it smelled awful and the bed was rock solid. We are not usually the type to complain and my first reaction was just to move hotels. By this time there was a different guy up front so i called on the phone and he very nicely showed us a different room that was remodeled on the first floor. I understand that sometimes this happens so we moved rooms , the air conditioner in the new room wouldn't turn on so someone looked at it , we took their word that it was finally working and went out. When we got back the room was extremly warm and when i called the front desk the guy came in and said ok.. lets move you this one dosn't work!!!!! AGAIN! They upgraded us to a king suit, very nice room , and he was very nice about it. The new room had 2 tv's in it... an old one and a new one, both in the same spot , neither hooked up. we sucked it up as bad luck and finally just wwent to bed. we just had a not soo great expeirance here , but.. the one front desk guy was very nice! however i would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Weekend 2007”
Reviews.Author: KSMeadowlark
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year that the Bobby Layne Orchestra choose the Lodge of the Ozarks for the annual Big Band Weekend party. The ballroom is at the hotel, plus the Club Las Vegas restaurant is on site, so everything was conveniently located. The food at the Club Las Vegas is very good. Service is excellent. A complimentary continental breakfast is included in the price of your stay. The breakfast lacked a lot in imagination. Apples and oranges were available on the breakfast. What is it about bananas at Branson? A banana on my cereal would have been nice. There is a wide variety of entertainment within easy walking distance of the hotel. The Hughes Brothers and Mickey Gilley's Theater were on either side of the Lodge. The Jim Stafford Theater and the Dutton's Theater are both directly across the street. The hotel is undergoing extensive renovation, so be prepared to be slightly inconvenienced during your stay. But the workmen are very polite and try to minimize disruption. I still haven't figured out if this hotel is pet friendly or not. When I called 3 months ago, they said pets were accepted; however, there were "no pets allowed" signs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at the Lodge of the Ozarks very helpful”
Reviews.Author: NutriCoach
Reviews.Content: I attended a reunion for Korean War veterans held at the Lodge of the Ozarks. The accomidations were very good and the staff was very helpful at every turn. I highly recommend them Toma Grubb

Reviews.Title: “Bad motel”
Reviews.Author: arktravler
Reviews.Content: THE front desk person was awful....NO help ... Took twice to get the right clean room. they kept sending us to unclean rooms. then about 7.00 at night another guest came into our room with a key. the front desk gave them the wrong room. that was pretty scarey. the room smelled. could not make coffee the next mornig the pot was dirty. we had ordered a ref. never delivered it. we checked out early. the front desk took care of the problems by giving us a 5.00 dicount on our bill. the motel is motel from hell. beware we stay in branson every year we always have a good time. we always look at trip advisor to help pick motels no one was helpful with our problems the motel is old and run down. but the service is what makes a good motel so this one is zero

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel from England and was recomended to stay here by one of the owners, Mr Merrill Osmond. had a really comfortable room, the staff were all really helpfull, and could'nt do enough to help me enjoy myself. The hotel theatre i must say was not to my taste because people were allowed to smoke so spoilt it for us no smokers. I intend on staying again this year and every time i am in branson. If you are lucky you may bump into Mr Osmond who will be only to please to say Hi. From Kay Molyneux

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 226AnneM226
Reviews.Content: I have been to Branson several times, but this was my first stay at the lodge. It was very nice and the staff was very friendly. You are on the strip close to many shows and restaurants. The room was a nice size, but my only complaint would be the huge bath tub! It is a whirlpool, and it was very hard to get into because it was so high! I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it!(I'll bring a step stool with me next time for the shower!)

Reviews.Title: “Lodge of Ozarks exudes with good feelings and kindness”
Reviews.Author: AnnF
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Lodge was wonderful. The employees could not be kinder or more helpful. Everyone I talked with had a smile on their face. I believe that the new management and ownership of the Lodge has brought about a feeling of spirit and peacefulness into the Lodge. I felt very welcomed and was treated very well. My room was lovely and well kept. The restaurant food was delicious. The theater is beautiful and fun. The pool it awesome. I will only stay at the Lodge when I visit Branson area. It is for sure my home away from home while in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Service was what made this stay memorable from the warm welcome at the reception desk, the friendly servers at breakfast and the nice maintenance man who helped us with a screwdriver. Can only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"FREE Continental Breakfasty"?????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had Reservations for over 3 weeks, which included the Lodging, approx. 6 shows, etc....Arrived at hotel, they had our reservatios, but no "vouchers" were there..Our first show was to be that evening at 8pm...still no vouchers...had to pay again for that show...next morning, still no vouchees...finally called our travel agent...He was local for Branson area, said all vouchers were sent the same time the Hotel Reservations were....?????Finally asked him to resend them, so waited in the Lobby...finally, we had to go ask again, & they THEN finally found them....as for their "advertised" free continental breakfast, they informed us that "you have not paid for the continental breakfast"....DID NOT KNOW YOU WERE REQUIRED TO PAY FOR A "FREE" BREAKFAST>>> All the shows were great, just extremly hot ..will return for sure for more shows, but never to stay at the Lodge of Ozarks....seems everyone was trying to blame everything on someone else....Still unable to find out how they got their reservations, but didn't get the vouchers for shows, when they were all sent at the same time..............

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: VegasRon
Reviews.Content: The room was the nicest I've ever stayed in other than suites. Very roomy. Next door to Mickey Gilley's. Dined at Gilley's cafe in the bar area and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but doubt return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is large and nice, good location. There are lots of amentities and extras if thats a priority, we personally didn't have time to use them. My main problem was the room itself, very standard and very outdated. The older wallpaper was dirty and the room had some funky smell that never diminished. The tub was very small and the shower too powerful, it hurt! There are much nicer rooms in Branson for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deskclerk102
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay in Branson. The location is simply unbeatable if you plan to frequent the Hwy. 76 theaters. We parked the car and walked everywhere we went (Except Shepherd of the Hills Area). The hotel is directly next door to the Mickey Gilley Theater; indoor pool and jacuzzi is excellent; staff is very helpful; indoor corridors provide added safety; rooms are very clean and comfortable. LOOK FOR COUPONS for this property. They are out there and can save you $10-$20 per night during certain periods.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I planned a golf trip. The staff was very courtious in helping me do that. The rest of the staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean and roomy, the food was great, and we was in the middle of everything. We would stay there again, and I would recommend The Lodge to anyone. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Needed special accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have MS and use a cooling vest in which the inserts need to be frozen. The staff were extremely helpful in making arrangements for them to be placed in the freezer. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Will definately stay when we return to Branson

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JodieMac
Reviews.Content: We moved to this motel after having some problems at another one. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet even though it's located on the strip. It's in a very good location, within walking distance to many popular places on the strip.

HotelInfo.Name: Lodge of the Ozarks
HotelInfo.Address: 3431 West Hwy 76, Branson, MO 65616
